key_responsibilities: Serve as a senior manager
Member's point of contact with interest and advocacy groups
Coordinate with legislative team to identify outreach opportunities
Staff the Member in select meetings
Work with Chief of Staff and Legislative Director to identify legislative and policy opportunities
requirements: Extensive experience working with interest groups

key_responsibilities: Implement traditional/digital media, communications, and public relations strategies
Manage busy mail operation
Manage high volume incoming constituent correspondence
Provide research for and responses to constituent correspondence
requirements: Ability to work in a fast-paced environment
Intranet Quorum and Capitol Hill experience

key_responsibilities: Staff front office and greet visitors
Answer phones
Coordinate and execute flag and tour requests
Supervise interns
Assist with mail processing
Help with other projects as needed
requirements: Previous Capitol Hill or internship experience

key_responsibilities: Structure and manage the Member’s daily schedule
Coordinate the Member’s travel and logistical details of meetings
Handle the Member’s personal correspondence
Fulfill various administrative duties including ethics/disclosure compliance
Work closely with other staff members in the district and in DC
Ensure smooth overall office operations
requirements: Strong oral and written communication skills
Ability to multi-task and thrive in a fast-paced environment
Poise, patience and a good sense of humor
Ability to successfully interact with different personality types

key_responsibilities: Oversee all district operations
Supervision of special projects
Work with casework staff
Represent the member at civic engagements
Manage district office operations
Work with the chief of staff and the Member to develop and implement policy objectives
Plan, assign and evaluate work of employees in district offices
Speak to local groups when the Member is unavailable
Maintain close communications with the Member, the Washington office and committee staff
Travel throughout the district
Meet with elected officials and representatives of local groups
Schedule meetings with federal and district government agencies
Respond to constituent telephone calls and mail
Perform other duties as assigned
requirements: Ability to provide necessary organization, leadership and motivation to manage a House office
Excellent oral and written communication skills
Thorough knowledge of legislative process and of House organization and procedures

key_responsibilities: Review and provide guidance on financial disclosure issues
Education and training to Members of Congress and their staff
requirements: Outstanding analytical and written and oral communication skills
Experience in government ethics, ethics counseling, corporate finance, securities law, and criminal law

key_responsibilities: Conduct investigations and adjudicatory and disciplinary proceedings regarding Members and staff
requirements: Outstanding analytical and written/oral communications skills
Experience in government ethics, criminal law, civil litigation, administrative investigations and adjudications, depositions, and financial accounting

key_responsibilities: Book proactive press for the member, including national TV interviews
Write press releases, columns, speeches, blogs and e-newsletters
requirements: Background and proven track record in booking national TV interviews

key_responsibilities: Manage Member’s official schedule
Manage travel arrangements
Manage personal correspondence
Perform various administrative duties
requirements: Ability to prioritize in a fast-paced environment
Ability to work cooperatively and courteously with others
Temperament to communicate with a variety of personalities
Good computer skills (Microsoft Word, Excel, Outlook, Publisher and Power Point)
Strong communication, analytical, and organization skills
Ability to relate well with individuals of diverse backgrounds
Thorough understanding of government agencies and structure
Ability to work efficiently and effectively as a member of a team
Ability to balance multiple projects simultaneously
Bachelor’s degree from an accredited four-year college or university
